programme.title: Legend FC #3
programme.desc: Legend Fighting Championship (Legend) was the Asia-Pacific championship of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). Legend invited national champion MMA fighters from throughout the Asia-Pacific region to compete in a freestyle tournament using interdisciplinary martial arts skills in supervised matches under a strict set of rules designed to promote athlete safety and sportsmanship. Legend was committed to promoting the sport of MMA throughout the region, to supporting and cultivating its athletes, and to providing exceptional entertainment to a broad audience.

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 1
programme.desc: In this episode, Ken Marschall gives us a compelling look back at Titanic’s last night through the eyes of survivor Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: Masabumi Hosono
programme.desc: The only Japanese passenger on Titanic helped save lives, but was ostracized back in his home country for the rest of his life. There’s been many published accounts about Hosono, but now Robert Bracken gives us the real story.

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: Matching Shoes What Else Can That Be?
programme.desc: Ken Marschall, who’s been to the Titanic wreck six times, remembers standing at the door of Robert Ballard’s office and telling him, “I’ve found the bodies...”

programme.title: How the Wreck Has Changed
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host and famed Titanic Explorer P.H. Nargeolet takes us back down to the wreck for a look at Titanic’s changing conditions and deterioration.

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Titanic's Morse Lamps
programme.desc: Before radio, ships had to communicate with each other visually. During the day they used hand flags and at night it was through morse lamps. Bill Sauder explains Titanic’s Lamps: where they were located and how they were used.

programme.title: Forward A Deck Promenade
programme.desc: It’s always been suggested that H&W decided to enclose the forward end of Titanic’s A deck promenade because Olympic’s first-class passengers had complained about sea spray. Mark Chirnside believes that might not be the reason and he explains why.

programme.title: The Anchor Crane Mystery - Ken Marschall
programme.desc: When the first images of Titanic came back in 1985, everyone noticed how the bow anchor crane was turned to a very unusual position; even considering the crash into the ocean floor. Jim Cameron’s got one theory about what happened and Ken Marschall’s...

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Please No Smoking But If You Must
programme.desc: In 1912 people knew that smoking was bad for your health. Titanic had designated nonsmoking areas around the ship but if you needed to light-up, the smoking lounges were waiting. Bill Sauder tells us there was more than just smoking going on inside.

programme.title: Did Titanic Have Inferior Steel?
programme.desc: It’s been a theory talked about for years; were the rivets and steel used in Titanic inferior? Parks looks at the science of the debate and very well may put an end to the controversy.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: The J.J. Davies Bag
programme.desc: As bodies were recovered on the Mackay-Bennett, they were given a number and the personal items found on the body were put into a mortuary bag. This is the real life story of one of those bags from Body No. 200!

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Titanic Movie Memorabilia
programme.desc: One of the most desired categories of collectibles for Titanic enthusiasts is the growing movie memorabilia market – From the Nazi German Titanic movie in 1943 to James Cameron’s 1997 blockbuster - it’s all out there.

programme.title: Transvulcania 2024
programme.desc: La Palma, the northernmost of the 8 Canary Islands welcomes since 2009 The Transvulcania Adidas Terrex Ultra Marathon. 2800 runners from all over the world compete in one of the four races, Half marathon, marathon, ultra marathon and vertical Km.

programme.title: New Zealand 9
programme.desc: In a race against time, three adventurers will set a new speed record by completing New Zealand’s nine Great Walks faster than they’ve ever been done before, using human power alone. It’s the ultimate adventure race. They’ll kayak 145 km, ride 80 km and run over 300 km in just nine days.

programme.title: Galaverna Winter Trail Race 2023
programme.desc: The Galaverna celebrates its 50th edition. We run 16 km across hills in wine country with a total climb of 450 meters in the dead of winter. Only the truly hardy participate. The weather is not your friend but at the end you celebrate with a hot plate of pasta.......

programme.title: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip
programme.desc: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip

programme.title: Best Via Ferrata In The Dolomites Climbing Possnecker Eng
programme.desc: Cris and Viv climb Piz Selva, a 2,941m mountain belonging to the Sella group, an iconic giant of the Dolomites.They start their hike from Passo Sella, and their chosen route was via Ferrata Possnecker (also called Ferrata delle Mesules), one of the oldest Via Ferratas in the Dolomites.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2023 - Episode 11
programme.desc: We commence this episode by journeying to Spain for the Palma Marathon Mallorca, celebrating its 19th edition this year. Next stop is Portugal and the TRITON World Series, renowned in the triathlon scene, which concluded its 2023 season in the Algarve region. Our adventure continues in Croatia, where Istria300 has burgeoned into Europes fastest-growing cycling project. The third edition attracted 2,800 participants from 40 countries to Porec. Next we move to Italy for a short presentation of the Dobbiaco-Cortina Cross Country Race 2024. Then we shift to France for the Equestrian European Championship Sports. We conclude our episode in Saudi Arabia with Tough Mudder obstacle course races which will happen soon in AlUla.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre 2023 - Summary #2 (Eng)
programme.desc: Second summary of the Transat Jacques Vabre 2023 with the race and the finish of the Ocean Fifty, Imoca and Class 40 categories.

programme.title: Nepal - The Other Side of Things
programme.desc: A unique spiritual voyage among the giant Himalayan mountains of Everest and Annapurna along ancient paths and across rivers, capturing the local beliefs to discover the marvels of an ancient mountain people in order to understand the meaning of self.

programme.title: Expedition Canada Season 2 Ep 8 (Eng)
programme.desc: Nathalie Long is trying to string together another world class expedition race. Episode8 : Finishers and Forwarders. The first few teams cross the line with little left in the tank. A few tears, bruises, and one visit tothe ER. There’s little that will slow this team down.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cléac'h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: The First Second - Sam Anthamatten
programme.desc: A specialist in high mountains, Sam is a committed freerider, but behind his instinct to ski, there is a guide: it is his job, his culture. At each line, an internal struggle begins between security and risk-taking ... The balance is difficult, with great freedom involved. Through his practice, he lives and perpetuates a mythical image, that of the Zermatt guide.

programme.title: Cape To Cape 2024 Eng
programme.desc: 800 riders have assembled for the 16th edition of the Australian Cape To Cape mountain bike stage race. Starting at Cape Leeuwin lighthouse and finishing four days later up at Cape Naturaliste, the course makes its way through a network of trails along the coast, through National Parks, forest, farm lands, mountain bike parks, and bush before heading up to the northern cape of the South West WA region. Roughly 200km and 2,500m of climbing in total, each day’s riding is between 34km and 59km and has its own special terrain and environment to keep things interesting with a mix of fast flowing single trail, farm tracks, groomed downhill trails and fire trails.

programme.title: Grand Banks 85 - A peculiar hull
programme.desc: Justin Ratcliffe is in Cannes on board the Grand Banks 85, the new flagship of the Grand Banks fleet. This boat has a very innovative hull, that is the result of the research on performance and fuel efficiency conducted by the company.

programme.title: Avalon Pontoon Cascade - MIBS 2025 Eng
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at MIBS 2025 aboard the Avalon Pontoon Cascade, a model with refined design and superior performance that offers an ideal combination of comfort and functionality.

programme.title: Ferretti Yachts 860 - 86 feet of lightness
programme.desc: Hop on board the new Ferretti Yachts 860, an incredible 86-foot superyacht. The size of the windows and the openings make the structure aesthetically light.

programme.title: Elegance and innovative solutions
programme.desc: Welcome aboard the new Absolute 56 Fly, an elegant and refined boat with exceptional performance. The engine is Volvo Penta and two IPS 800s are mounted on this model.

programme.title: Andrea Frabetti – Sunseeker innovation
programme.desc: Bill Hackett interviews Andrea Frabetti, CEO of Sunseeker Yachts, at the 2024 Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show, celebrating the growth of the brand. On board the new Sunseeker Predator 55, Frabetti talks about the companys commitment to development, innovation and dedication to production.

programme.title: Beneteau Oceanis 40.1 - Tailored to your every need
programme.desc: Each generation of Beneteau sailboats has distinctive features and innovative solutions that distinguish it from other models. In this episode, our Federico takes us to discover the innovation and creativity of Beneteau, aboard the Oceanis 40.1.

programme.title: Moon 60 - Multihull Show 2023
programme.desc: Federico Maselli is at the International Multihull Show, France, on board of the catamaran Moon 60.

programme.title: Hanse 460 Annapolis Boat Show 2022
programme.desc: Sail on board the Hanse 460, seen at Annapolis Boat Show 2022. Bill Hackett interviews Ken Comerford, from North Point Yacht Sales.

programme.title: Italia Yachts 14.98 Bellissima - Recognisable and unique
programme.desc: How to make a boat memorable? Italia Yachts answers this question with its new Italia Yachts 14.98 Bellissima, taking the concept of beauty to its extreme. Jump on board with our Bacci Del Buono and discover this highly performant cruise sailboat by Italia Yachts.

programme.title: Allures 51.9 - The power of aluminum
programme.desc: Discover the beautiful Allures 51.9, the sailing boat of your dreams, built in aluminum and perfect to go around the world and visit any sea in any weather condition.

programme.title: Ganga Bruni - The interview
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese interviews for you Ganga Bruni, coach of the National Olympic team of competitive sailing.

programme.title: Jeanneau Yachts 55 Legacy of innovation
programme.desc: Hop on board the Jeanneau 55, presented at the Boot in Dusseldorf. This incredible sailboat is destined to leave a mark, discover why with Antonio Vettese.

programme.title: Ecoracer 25 - A virtuous triptych
programme.desc: Too often the disposal of sails and hulls does not respect the environment. So how to get totally green boating? Come and discover with The Boat Show the Ecoracer 25, a sailboat designed by Matteo Polli and built in a completely recyclable fiber compound.

programme.title: 69F - Alessandra Angelini
programme.desc: Alessandra Angelini tells us about her experience aboard the 69F.

programme.title: Lagoon 42 St. Petersburg Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett boards the Lagoon 42 sailing catamaran, one of the most sought after boats of the moment. It is suitable for any nautical need and desire.

programme.title: Y Yachts Y7 - Easy sailing
programme.desc: The hull of the new Y Yachts 7 sailing yacht is technologically advanced but also simple in order to guarantee a pleasant and easy sailing.

programme.title: Beneteau First 36 - Filled with innovation
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board a stunning sailboat, the Beneteau First 36. Developed by Seascape, this boat is fun to sail and filled with innovation! Hop on board to discover why.

programme.title: SF 400 - A small sailboat
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the SF 400, a sailboat designed for an ownerlover of the Gulf of Trieste and regattas. Built in Slovenia by Ocean Tec isoptimized for a light wind.

programme.title: Ice Cup - 2023 Eng
programme.desc: Welcome to the fourth edition of the Ice Cup in Santa Margherita Ligure. A splendid setting as a backdrop to this incredible event which hosts the large fleet of Ice Yachts.

programme.title: Miami Boat Show 2020 - Sailing boats
programme.desc: Do you want to cross the Atlantic or perhaps charter in the Caribbean? Whatever you are looking for, you will find it at the Miami Boat Show, where American market trends meet varied needs. This is the place to be.

programme.title: Fountain Pajot Elba 45 Live your dream
programme.desc: Live your dream on board aboard the cruising catamaran 45 Elba by Fontaine Pajot. Very sleek, stylish and easy to maneuver, even solo.

programme.title: Solaris 50 - Quality and value
programme.desc: Lights on the Solaris 50, a good boat, good value for money, solid contents and great fun. Here in Porto Piccolo discover the fifth model built, where the interiors have been designed by Lucio Micheletti, the yard’s technical department.

programme.title: Leopard 40 Miami Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese presents the Leopard 40 Powercat, the smallest boat in the shipyards motor range. Despite its size, it maintains the DNA of its sisters, guaranteeing the same level of comfort and performance.

programme.title: Beneteau Oceanis 60 – Large volumes
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the Oceanis 60, the flagship of the Beneteau brand production. This BlueWater can face any navigation, both for its structural characteristics and for its autonomy.

programme.title: Solaris Yachts - The Shipyards
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you to Aquileia, for an exclusive visit inside the Solaris shipyard. Historically well-known as a sailboat manufacturer, has recently started building motorboats. Discover it with The Boat Show.

programme.title: A day with Traveler David Ramirez at Engine 3
programme.desc: Station 3, Engine 3 "A" Shift with Captain Palmer. Travelers are Firefighters without a Station for a home, and they cover all firefighters at all the stations in a Battalion. Today, we are with Firefighter David Ramirez as he works in the kitchen on some chow. A fire alarm goes off, and the firemen arrive on scene to find a leak. They find the main valve and take care of the problem. Next, a call comes in for a structure fire, and the firemen arrive on-scene to find a homeless person operating a BBQ inside a vacant home that is supposed to be secured by this plywood. Engine 3 has to deal with a tremendous amount of homeless in this part of town. Next, another structure fire, its busy day in the high heat of Central California, The building is vacant, but still dangerous.

programme.title: Eng 3 Apartment Fire Part 1
programme.desc: The crew of Engine 3s "A" Shift start their day with some of the best tacos in town, a call comes for a fire; the arrive on-scene to a mattress fire possibly set by a homeless person. Then a call comes in for a structure fire. They arrive on scene to a second floor apartment. Captain Palmer takes Command and his crew go into action. Firemen is Garcia on the pump panel, Firefighter Silva pulls the nozzle up the steps, and safely puts on his PPE and they head into the fire.Arson investigation arrives on scene. Back at the station, a quick bit of food, and another call comes in for a structure fire and the Palmer and the crew head out the door.

programme.desc: Chris Smeltzer's journey into MMA began 12 years ago, through Karate. Chris' work as a School Bus driver fits perfectly with his MMA lifestyle, allowing him the flexibility to train throughout the day, as well run a karate school for kids. The martial artist lifestyle helped bring structure to all areas of Chris' life. He believes he has become a better person through Martial Arts, and he makes the mental distinction between between being a fighter and being Martial Artist. He prefers the standup game feels he is progressing well to being an all around fighter with his BJJ Blue Belt.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 8
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part exploration of the militarys mobile cities. Aircraft carriers function like massive well-oiled machines that expand the reach of the armed services.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 9
programme.desc: Part two of a two-part episode on aircraft carriers that shows the sailors and pilots performing the seemingly miraculous task of catching a jet moving at 150 mph on a ships deck thats only 300 ft. long.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 10
programme.desc: The most prolific large ship in the fleet, destroyers were originally built to protect larger ships, but their ability to take on anything that comes their way, from air or sea, makes them formidable opponents in their own right.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 11
programme.desc: The second-largest ships in the fleet, after aircraft carriers, cruisers function as mobile missile platforms, always on the lookout for enemy aircraft or incoming missiles.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 12
programme.desc: Stand on the deck and crouch through the holds of the vessels that have inspired countless movies. From the modern computer stations to the apparently timeless engine rooms, real-life submarines have just as many stories to tell.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 13
programme.desc: Exciting footage of submarines ripping through the waves and breaking through thick sheets of ice. Anywhere, in any season, the sailors operating these stealthy ships are always prepared for action.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 14
programme.desc: Whether theyre rolling, sailing, or standing in place, cannons employed by modern military forces are a far cry from the first gunpowder projectiles found in 12th century China.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 15
programme.desc: Rockets can take our space program to the next frontier or deliver an enemy target back to the stone ages. It takes a balance of science and courage to build and deploy these payload delivery systems, as well as their more sophisticated, guidance-controlled siblings, missiles.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 16
programme.desc: Keep your eye on the target alongside soldiers on the training grounds, as they master the weapons used by modern military forces.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 17
programme.desc: Hand-held or vehicle-mounted, a soldiers weapon is one of their most important tools in the defense of the nation.

programme.title: The Lumineers - Live At Musilac 2017
programme.desc: The Lumineers bring energetic American folk-rock to the picturesque Musilac Festival. You won’t be able to resist clapping along and stomping your feet to the band’s raw sound and enchanting music.

programme.title: Blondie - Live in London 2014
programme.desc: Filmed at Roundhouse, London, this concert film will give all fans a spectacular Live experience from start to finish. Blondie performs her hits including ''Heart of Glass", "Euphoria", ''Mile High" and many more…

programme.title: Rainbow Reef Relaxation 2
programme.desc: Sit back, relax and enjoy the dazzling world of coral reefs in 4K you embark on a journey through some of the most vibrant underwater reefs on our blue planet - including many scenes which no longer look like this due to coral bleaching. From the cinematographer: "The footage for this film was shot over a period of some years in French Polynesia, Micronesia, Indonesia and East Timor. Unfortunately there are not that vibrant anymore today. Coral reefs have suffered from the rise of water temperature, rise in acidity, destructive fishing methods and severe storms caused by climate change." - Peter Schneider. "Rainbow Reef Relaxation" is a 3-hour long, sweeping yet majestic & vibrant underwater journey to the world's most beautiful lagoons, as captured by Nature Relaxation collaborator Peter Schneider (Underwatercam) paired with ambient underwater sounds and brand new ambient music by the Cynic Project. Filmed in High Definition several years ago, thanks to its age this film offers magical glimpses of an underwater world that is bursting with life, color, and beauty.

programme.title: Sunrise Meditation
programme.desc: Ease into the day with the sound of lapping waves and breathtaking beaches from around the world.

programme.title: The Soothing Sun
programme.desc: Rejoice and relax in the splendor of the glorious Sun for a full hour, with this new video by David Huting. This version features only the sounds of Nature, and offers a visual journey featuring many scenes of glorious sunrises and sunsets from locations such as Yosemite, Big Sur, Hawaii, Santorini, Sydney, The Canadian Rockies, Arches, Canyonlands, the Fiji Islands, and much more. Featuring music by Relax Moods.

programme.title: Hidden Tropical Paradise 2
programme.desc: Have you ever wanted to just escape from it all? Now you can turn any screen into a window to a hidden garden island, located in the the remote north-eastern islands of Fiji. Begin your journey as the sun pierces through trees as vibrant blue waves break on a white sandy beach; progress up the island to a lush lookout, and enjoy distant wave breaks, trees and birds, and passing clouds. Finally transport yourself back to the beach as the day continues and end it with a beautiful sunset scene as it falls over a distant mountain. It's 120 minutes of pure nature bliss!

programme.title: Benang Kelambu & Stokel: Indonesia
programme.desc: Experience a breathtaking waterfall flowing down a forest wall, surrounded by overgrown vines.

programme.title: Martha Argerich, Lily Maisky, Iddo Bar-Shai & Tedi Papavrami - Martha Argerich – A Birthday Celebration III
programme.desc: On the occasion of her 80th birthday, Argentinian pianist Martha Argerich explored chamber music repertoire in this wonderful concert, recorded at Château de Chantilly, France. The ‘Grande Dame’ of the piano is joined by various renowned artists, including pianists Lily Maisky and Iddo Bar-Shaï, violinists Tedi Papavrami and Akiko Suwanai, her daughter Lyda Chen-Argerich on viola, and cellist Mischa Maisky. On the program are Felix Mendelssohn’s Piano Trio No. 1 in D minor, Op. 49; Leoš Janáček’s Violin Sonata; Franz Schubert’s Rondo in A major, D. 951; and Johannes Brahms’s Piano Quartet No. 3 in C minor, Op. 60. These performances were recorded on May 4 and June 13, 2021.

programme.title: Les Dissonances & David Grimal - Brahms - Symphony No. 1 in C minor, Op. 68
programme.desc: Les Dissonances is a collective of artists founded by violinist David Grimal in 2004. The conductorless ensemble consists of musicians from the most prestigious European orchestras, international soloists, and young talents. In this performance, Les Dissonances present Johannes Brahms’s Symphony No. 1 in C minor, Op. 68. Brahms realized he was expected to compose a symphony that would match the musical standards established by Ludwig van Beethoven. After working on it for at least fourteen years, he completed his Symphony No. 1 in 1876. Brahms’s symphony was hailed as ‘Beethoven’s Tenth’: a worthy successor to Beethoven’s Symphony No. 9. Brahms’s work contains several references to Beethoven. For instance, the main theme of the fourth movement – first appearing in the strings – resembles the ‘Ode to Joy’ in the finale of Beethoven’s Symphony No. 9. This performance was recorded at Philharmonie de Paris, France, in 2014.

programme.title: Soloists of the Lucerne Festival Orchestra - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Ivan Fischer & Budapest Festival Orchestra - Works by Bach, Bartók, and Brahms
programme.desc: Iván Fischer leads his Budapest Festival Orchestra in an exciting concert program consisting of works by J. S. Bach, Béla Bartók, and Johannes Brahms. The program opens with Bach’s Brandenburg Concerto No. 3 in G major, BWV 1048. This is followed by one of Bartók’s best-known pieces: Music for strings, percussion and celesta. Remarkable is the work’s instrumentation: Bartók divided the strings into two groups that are placed on opposite sides of the stage, to create antiphonal effects. The program ends with Brahms’s Symphony No. 3 in F major, Op. 90. This performance was recorded at the Béla Bartók National Concert Hall in Budapest, Hungary, on December 4, 2017.

programme.title: Gilberto Gil - Gilberto Gil: Jazz à Vienne
programme.desc: Brazilian artist Gilberto Gil returns to Jazz à Vienne in France with a new round of singing that is inspired by his latest album ‘Fé na Festa’: a mixture of celebration, tradition and even some rock now and then. Gilberto Gil, worldwide known for as musician and the Brazilian minister of Culture, was one of the pioneers of the cultural movement ‘tropicalismo’. This movement, with a strong character of social protest, combines elements of traditional Brazilian culture with modern art forms. Gilberto Gil's new sound clearly has its roots in Brazilian culture, yet it is always inspired by jazz.

programme.title: Paul Desmond - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Chucho Valdis - Obatalà
programme.desc: Legendary Cuban pianist Chucho Valdés brought his band ‘Jazz Batá 2’ to the Malta Jazz Festival on July 19, 2019. The air was thick with anticipation as Valdés took to the stage, revisiting the small-group concept of his mythical 1972 Cuban album ‘Jazz Batá’. The batá repertoire – the deep classical music of West Africa – permeates Valdés’ piano solos throughout the concert. Valdés’s band consists of Dreiser Durruthy (Batas and vocals), Yaroldy Abreu (percussions and vocals), Abraham Mansfarroll (percussion), Ramón Vazquez Martirena-Bajo (bass guitar). They delivered a performance that reverberated through the historic island.

programme.title: The Monty Alexander Trio - Monty Alexander Quartet - Noth Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. On July 13, 1979, talented Jamaican pianist Monty Alexander was joined by Reggie Johnson (bass), Frank Gant (drums), Bobby Thomas (hand drum), and Othello Molineaux (steel drum) at the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. Alexander's Caribbean influences and natural flair for the piano shine through in this brilliant performance.

programme.title: Bill Evans - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Muddy Waters, Horace Silver & Dizzy Gillespie - H. Silver, M. Waters, D. Gillespie - Newport Jazz
programme.desc: The Newport Jazz Festival, first established in the North-American town of Newport, Rhode Island in the summer of 1954, has now grown to become one of the largest multi-day celebrations of jazz worldwide. It has resulted in numerous famous live albums from top-rate jazz stars, and has spawned several worldwide tours, including editions of the Newport Jazz Festival in Rotterdam, The Netherlands. In 1968, the Newport Jazz Festival in Rotterdam welcomed three talented Americans: pianist Horace Silver, guitarist Muddy Waters, and trumpeter Dizzy Gillespie, alongside their bands.

programme.title: Lalah Hathaway - Somethin'
programme.desc: Winner of five Grammys in four consecutive years, including the Grammy for best R&B album in 2017, Lalah Hathaway is a force impossible to ignore. The American artist has shared the scene with Prince, Snoop Dogg, Stevie Wonder, Anita Baker, Mary J. Blige, Frank Ocean and many others, an irrefutable proof of her keen musical sense and enormous talent. With a 26-year career, Hathaway is still highly sought after by the biggest names in music. See her transform the 2018 Sing Jazz festival scene into a real R&B club, where she flaunts her voice and stage presence out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Buddy Rich, Tom Warrington, Bob Kaye & John Marshall - Buddy Rich Big Band - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. Buddy Rich, one of the most influential jazz drummers of all time, performed at the North Sea Jazz Festival of 1978 with his orchestra. Rich's drumming was known for its remarkable speed and dexterity, which he achieved without any formal education.

programme.title: UFA 342-343 - Bare Knuckle Boxing 32
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 32 part 1 from London. In the flyweight devision, Salim Jamshidi and Joe Fitzpatrick, both making their pro BKB debut, battle for the win. Stanlee Wilson faces Tony Barratt, Reece Murray takes on the much more experienced Jonny Lawson, Danny Meins goes head to head with Tony Meeham and Martyn Grainger faces Eryk Majda in the Cruiserweight division. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 32 part 2 from London. Steven Evans takes on Matty Moore in a Wales versus Ireland fight in the middleweight division. Beau Besley faces Michael Devine in a featherweight clash, Lawrence Tracey and Kevin Greenwood match up in a light-heavyweight bout, Scott McHugh takes on Aaron McCallum in a British Bantamweight title fight. In the main event Jimmy Sweeney takes on Kearon Thomas in the lightweight division.

programme.title: UFA 317 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) - Millender vs. Ahmadyar
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting, UNF - Millender versus Ahmad from Burbank, CA. In this episode of UFA Christopher Padilla faces El J Portee in a Catchweight bout and Jesse Strader with an 80 knockout rate takes on Taylor Alfaro. The main event is a battle between Northern and Southern California and the title for the UNF Middleweight Championship is on the line when Bellator and UFC veteran Curtis Millender takes on top ranked Salaiman Ahmadyar.

programme.title: UFA 344 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 8 - Wassmer vs. Lua
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 8 from Southern California. In this episode, Kester Abad faces Dylan Stockard in a flyweight bout and Daniel Labastida and Matheus Santos face off in a bantamweight contest. Also watch as David Babakhanyan takes on Daniel Gualajara and in the main event, Elwig Wassmer, defending title holder and a biochemist looks to take on Israel Lua (Ben Jones camp) with knockout power, in whats expected to be a combustible fight with two titles on the line. The fighters contend for both the UNF flyweight title and the California state championship title.

programme.title: UFA 316 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) - Rivera vs. Gibson
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting - UNF Rivera versus Gibson from Burbank, CA. Starting things off, Albert Lee faces Bryant Shell then Dion Young and Saad Ul-Hasan are looking to have a quick finish. In the Main Event UFC veterans Francisco Rivera and Cody Gibson fight to become the first Bantamweight UNF Champion.

programme.title: Issaya
programme.desc: The dining room is a daring mix of classic and modern furniture on terracotta tile floors with unusually colourful wallpapers. The whole room basks in a very soft light and the result works surprising well. The menu, both in Thai and English, is not illustrated but cleverly written, keeping the phonetic dish names instead of an elaborated but hard to visualize description. The wine list is substantial and several excellent wines are available by the glass.

programme.title: Fun Stuff to do in Brooklyn
programme.desc: Have fun like a kid. Andrew Zimmer tells us where to get ice cream, play video games, go bowling, and more things to do in Brooklyn.

programme.title: Marco Bettio
programme.desc: Owner and founder Marco Bettio speaks about his journey to success, and bringing a bit of "Italian Love" to Shanghai.Marco’s infectious personality immediately disarms you, it’s no wonder Goodfellas is one of the city’s best establishments to find authentic Italian comfort food. His passion for authenticity and obsession for comfort, pours out every minute you spend here. This place has a charming personality and we went directly to the source.Interview: MARCO BETTIOWhen I came here 10 years ago and started to do some consulting. I started to receive a lot of guests from all around the world..and I was always forced to bring them to fine dining places. I noticed that my clients weren’t really comfortable in the fine dining experience the first day they arrived in Shanghai.That’s what moved me to bring this real Italian dining experience to this area. I would say that we would always try to give a tailormade type of service. Greeting everybody, making them feel comfortable, it’s one of the most important things for us.Actually, “Goodfellas”..is meant to mean “good friends”..and this is the idea. There is no ego, there is no name of the chef, or my name on the door,..nothing but “Goodfellas.” It’s a place to for a good time with your friends, business partners, clients..to have an intimate experience in an enjoyable way.Chef Antonio is a great master, we actually call him “the maestro”,..it’s the italian way to address a very experienced chef. Since day one, Chef has been in charge of everything inside the kitchen...scouting the best ingredients and creating the recipes. Coming from big hotels, he initially wanted the kitchen to be very serious, less smiling, less interactive, etc..I never agreed with this, so we had to find a balance. And it took almost a year until we found that balance,...after he saw the happy customers and atmosphere we knew we were on to something and it because very harmonic. There is never an argument between the kitchen and the staff, and it’s amazing. This is a very big achievement..norma

programme.title: Michaela Guzy's Top Unexpected NYC Experiences
programme.desc: Michaela Guzy, New Yorker and founder of the website Oh The People You Meet, shares her favorite hidden gems in the city.

programme.title: The Story of the Zhonghe Animal Shelter
programme.desc: The Story of the Zhonghe Animal Shelter In Taiwan, the issue of homeless animals has been a cause for concern for many years, and even in the capital city of Taipei, stray dogs and cats are a common sight. Taiwan saw a rise in abandoned animals during the 1980’s, during a time of economic growth. Residents who were uninformed of the responsibilities that comes with raising a pet, eventually abandoned said animals on the streets. Today, we have invited Godfrey Gao, a Taiwanese-Canadian actor, model and humanitarian, to interview the Director of the Animal Epidemic Prevention Center. The setting is at the Zhonghe Animal Shelter, a place that has truly become a haven for stray dogs in recent years.Operating under the government of New Taipei City, Zhonghe Animal Shelter seeks to provide unwanted dogs with the safest and best care they can afford. Upon entering their care, every animal will be given vaccination, a health screening, de-worming, microchip implantation, and are spayed or neutered. Depending on their gender, male dogs will receive a mark on the left ear, while females are marked on the right ear. Once the process is finished, these dogs are ready for adoption.While there are other breeds at the animal shelter, their stay is never long since they get adopted rather swiftly, leaving the shelter with a 90 majority of the Formosan Mountain Dog, or more simply known as, Taiwanese Dog. The characteristics of the Taiwanese dog breed include a triangular face, agile feet that are known for their hopping skill, and a sickle tail. The personality of the Formosan is loyal, intelligent, affectionate and understanding. “These dogs are suited for being hunting or search dogs, so the current feeding rate for these dogs is quite high. We mainly have black ones, but we also have brown and yellow ones,” says the Director.Currently, most, if not all the dogs at the Shelter have been desexed. This ‘zero-kill’ plan started on the 1st of March last year, under the guidance of the mayor of New Taipei City, Zhu Li Luen. Howeve

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: Brunch in Manhattan
programme.desc: A guide to the best brunch spots in NYC that includes oysters, avocado toast, best rosé wine list, Southern California menu, and farm-to-table for weekend brunch.

programme.title: Things to do in Al Quoz, Dubai’s art hub, home to Alserkal Avenue, artisan cafes and classic cars
programme.desc: Once just an overlooked industrial estate hidden behind the high-rises of Dubai’s Sheikh Zayed Road, Al Quoz is now the beating heart of the citys art scene. Home to Alserkal Avenue – actually a block of streets lined with some of the best art galleries in Dubai – Al Quoz is full of surprises. There’s more than world-class art hidden behind Al Quozs vast landscape of warehouses; where theres art, theres life, after all – and life here is vibrant. Just about every enterprise in Al Quoz comes with an exciting twist; for example, Al Quoz restaurant and speciality coffee bar Café Rider doubles as a custom motorbike store. Mirzam , meanwhile, is an artisan chocolate factory thats also a café, located in the neighbourhood’s central art hub, Alserkal Avenue . Alserkal Avenue cafes are defined by their fair-trade principles and creative concoctions that echo the area’s artistic character. From golden turmeric lattes to immune-boosting vegan matcha bowls, menus are bursting with goodness. Things to do in Alserkal Avenue and neighbouring complex, The Courtyard, include inspiring workshops; there are several to choose between. At Oo La Lab , a fragrance mixology studio in Alserkal Avenue, you can learn how to create your own signature cologne. Or, just across the road, you can join an art class in Dubai’s popular community art space thejamjar . Going strong for 15 years, thejamjar is a regular host of Alserkal Avenue events and art lessons, teaches budding artists of all ages several disciplines, from painting with oils to acrylic techniques. Tilika D’Souza, an art instructor at thejamjar, says the wellbeing of the participants is also important to the foundation: "We have a workshop called Intuitive Creativity that combines meditation and art; we use all kinds of different art materials and we do a little meditation to begin with, so everybody is really relaxed during and after the class." For those who prefer to shop, tempting retail options include independent boutiques, such as Chi-Ka , a

programme.title: Dubai acts to stem the tide of single use plastic
programme.desc: Dubai’s airports have banned all single use plastics as the city works towards a plastic-free future. It comes as the attitude towards single use plastics is changing. In Dubai, 90 per cent of people say they are making a conscious effort to reduce their own plastic waste consumption. Nearly four in five say they recycle more now than they did five years ago. And one in four people say theyre encouraged to recycle more by corporations championing plastic-free initiatives. Dubai International Airport along with Dubai World Central welcome almost 90 million passengers each year. But with those passengers comes 5,500 tonnes of plastic. The airports’ operator, Dubai Airports, banned all single use plastics from inside the terminal at the beginning of this year. That means that plastic cutlery, water bottles, drinking straws, packaging and polythene bags are all banned from cafes and restaurants. Eugene Barry, Dubai Airports’ executive vice president (commercial), told Focus: “Ninety five per cent of our partners have actually made the pledge to switch from plastic to appropriate and relevant substitutes for some of the products that are used in catering and retail across the airport.” The operator hopes its a strategy that might become a template for other major transportation hubs and businesses. “This is very much the early stages of a long journey, I believe, to have a more environmentally friendly approach to managing businesses,” Barry said. Dubai’s 700 hotels are already looking at alternatives, such as switching water bottles from plastic to glass. Plastic key cards could also be a thing of the past, as developers look into switching them to wood-based materials. The eco packaging company Avani is one firm offering plastic-free alternatives, including a bag made from cassava, a cheap and common root vegetable. The material is biodegradable and compostable, breaking down over a period of months on land or at sea. Peter Avram, managing director of Avani Middle East, said: “Until a c

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Needing a break from the bright lights of the big city? An escape to a simpler way of life is just a 90 minute trip from Bangkok to Monkey Island in Samut Songkhram province. For 700bht you can take a boat ride to meet the famous swimming monkeys and see how the local fishing community (Khlong Klone) lives. After feeding those ravenous monkeys some bananas, treat yourself to some amazing local seafood. It may be a perfect end to a low key Sunday after a night of the other kind of monkey business.

programme.title: Karaiya Spice House
programme.desc: For those that like to feel the burn, make a trip to Karaiya Spice House for some Hunan-style heat. Authentic Hunan dishes are beautifully presented at this award winning, lair of spice. A bouquet of Hunan chilis accompanies many of Karaiya’s menu items, but the restaurant does offer milder fare to tame the flames. Signature items include smoked ribs, steamed fish with chilis and flame-baked prawns wrapped in foil. Located on the 3rd floor of Sanlitun Village, Karaiya will also win you over with its elegant and understated design. Just remember that “normal” here is still very spicy.

programme.title: Shop Local in NYC

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: The biodiversity of Dubai's shores has brought fly fishing to the Middle East for the first time
programme.desc: When most people think of fly fishing they think of being far out in the wilderness, away from civilisation, by a river or somewhere in the ocean. But Ocean Active Fly has re-imagined this scene - offering urban fly fishing right in the middle of Dubai. This is the first fly fishing operation in the Middle East. The founder, Nick Bowles, explained to Euronews why fishing there are fishing opportunities in Dubai: "Dubai’s built the biggest man-made reefs with the palm islands and that, so it’s created a huge habitat." Artificial reefs can lead to a quick increase in the local fish population. They draw plankton which smaller fish can prey on which then attracts bigger fish suitable for fly fishing. One species drawn to the artificial reefs in Dubai is the queenfish. They can grow to be over a metre long and up to 15 kilograms, although most are about half that weight. This kind of fish is particularly good for fly fishing because of its visual takes and the fact it swims in schools. Fly fishing differs from more conventional spin fishing. Instead of having a heavy lure at the end of the fishing line, fly fishers have a fly which is lighter and less likely to scare away game. The fly stays on the surface of the water where fish will be attracted to it, thinking it is prey. With ocean fly fishing youre constantly on the move to find the next school of fish "So you literally run - shoot, run - shoot." But the unique part of fly fishing in Dubai is the proximity to its skyline. Fly fishing is done close to the shore so anglers are surrounded by the citys landmarks.: the Burj Khalifa, the Burj Al Arab, Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina.

programme.title: Liya Wang
programme.desc: The Story of Liya WangThe “Black Pearl” of Taiwan, supermodel Liya Wang, was nicknamed thus due to her dark, tanned complexion; she perfectly embodies the strong, empowered women at the forefront of the fitness movement today. Looking at her million-watt smile now, little would one have guessed that Liya also went through a dark period in her life. When she won the ELLE Model Look competition back in 2005, at the very height of her career, she bid farewell to the life of glitz and glamour and moved to Shanghai to live a quiet life of marital bliss with her then-newly-wed husband, Lin Yongchao. Just two years into the marriage, the once happy couple divorced and went their separate ways. The period that followed was a downward spiral that Liya finds hard to look back upon even now. Yet, like a phoenix rising from the ashes, she found a new burning passion that reawakened her zest for life - her love of fitness and exercise.Today, Liya has taken time out of her day to tell us her story and recent endeavors. With smooth, sun-kissed skin and minimal make up, Liya flashes us her pearly-whites that remind us of the famous Disney character, Pocahontas. Growing up, becoming a model never crossed Liya’s mind. She perceived her tanned skin and naturally curly hair as against the norm of what was considered aesthetically beautiful, and was naturally surprised when she was approached by a stylist while strolling in Ximending, one of Taipei’s popular shopping districts. The stylist asked her to go in for a casting at Eelin, the model management company in which she is currently still signed to today. As it was Summer break and she had little to do, Liya decided to go to the casting with little expectations, and thus unwittingly began her fifteen-year-long career.It wasn’t all smooth sailing from there, especially the first couple of years into the modelling business. Liya found herself trying to be someone else, fitting into the mold of the successful models before her, afraid to stand out and be herself. Her skin tone, her h

programme.title: Scopa Italian Roots
programme.desc: Scopas airplane hangar-like space in Venice is dominated by a 50-foot bar, communal high-tops, booming acoustics, and a jovial crowd at happy hour. The resulting vibe can only be described as surprisingly pleasant chaos. Bartenders are yelling out NEGRONI orders, servers are dancing around tables to drop Italian cold-cut platters, and diners are leaning in to converse over piles of handmade noodles.About those noodles: Top Chef vet Antonia Lofaso cooks upscale Italian with no fuss, like RIGATONI with vodka sauce and more modern takes like CRESTE RIGATE with morels and English peas. She smears nutty ricotta on ciabatta crostini and then leaves it rightly un-messed-with except for some quality olive oil and fresh parsley. The DEEP-FRIED FLUFFERNUTTER for dessert reminds you that life—and perhaps cardiac health—shouldnt be taken too seriously.

programme.title: La Mer, Dubai’s newest beachfront neighbourhood, offers hip restaurants, water sports and fun parks
programme.desc: With the construction of Dubai’s latest luxury residential development, Port de La Mer by Meraas , and new hotel, Rove La Mer , La Mer is a of rising interest in today’s property market. La Mer, open since 2017, is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside neighbourhoods, nestled on the northern shoreline. Divided into two areas, La Mer South and La Mer North, it’s defined by its retro Californian style. The Instagram-friendly destination offers a heady mix of water sports, fun parks, fashionable restaurants, street art and seasonal parties after dark. By day, visitors can hire sunbeds or rent wooden day rooms on La Mer Beach. The multi-coloured beach huts house showers. La Mer beach club, Train , is fully licensed with a shisha area, but its name is derived from its fitness facilities – it has a gym and a boxing and yoga studio – and its Origin 33 restaurant and lounge also serves healthy meals and a menu of fresh juices and smoothies. The best restaurants in La Mer, according to local award-givers, include Masti , a beachfront eatery applauded for its modern Indian cuisine, innovative mixology and eclectic interior design by Studio Lotus. The name Masti is derived from the Hindi word for fun and mischief and the décor and dishes live up to the name, with cheeky monkey artwork and playful fusions for the palate such as the tandoori chicken bao. Another creative culinary outlet is iScream . Managing Partner Rami Halawi came up with the concept for iScream with his family. Offering a wide selection of unusual flavours is the brand’s unique selling point. “Here at iScream, we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, tabbouleh, ketchup and Mexican chilli-chocolate,” says Rami. On certain days, customers are invited to scream into a sound monitor for their ice cream – if they beat the highest recording in decibels, they win their ice cream for free. La Mer’s shops focus on beach pursuits and accessories, making it a good place to shop for swimwear, sunglasses, suntan lotion

programme.title: World Mysteries - Butch Cassidy:Demise By Bullet or Old Age?
programme.desc: Legend says the famous bank and train robbers Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid fled to South America and were killed in a gun battle with Bolivian soldiers. Legend also says they survived. This program examines fact and folklore to resolve this debate.

programme.title: Medical Mysteries: ancient Healers or Modern Technology?
programme.desc: Cave paintings found in France that depict the use of plants for medicinal purposes carbon-date to 25,000 BC. What did the ancients know? Are there methods and medicines they used that could eliminate some of the most life-threatening illnesses of today?

programme.title: Tales of the Dead: Grim Stories of Curses, Horror and Gore
programme.desc: Five friends gather on Halloween to continue their ritual of telling horror stories. Each one telling a more sinister tale than the next, unaware of the horror that awaits them on this all Hallows eve. A film from award winning director Kemal Yildirim. Less is More: May Walker suffers from a disorder known as BIID (Body Integrity Identity Disorder). She has a constant desire to be an amputee to feel complete. She struggles to cope until one day when a mysterious doctor makes her an offer that’s impossible to refuse. (Awarded top 10 in the Zone Horror competition and shown at Fright Fest) Wolf Cry: Zack is a slacking teenager who is obsessed with horror movies to the point where nothing else matters. His constant daydreaming derails his life until one night he experiences something that profoundly changes his world forever. Penance: The city is in the grip of a sadist serial killer. Detective Klein is a recovering alcoholic whose career is in tatters until he is chosen by the serial killer to play a horrifying game of cat and mouse. Missing: Five friends investigating an ancient curse on Cromwell Street in England discover far more than they bargained for when they unknowingly unleash a dark force that has been lying dormant for centuries. Includes Special Features

programme.title: 3:15 AM
programme.desc: LONG - Horror strikes at 3:15 AM in ways never before imagined. Truth is stranger than fiction in this euro horror anthology that opens a new dimension in sheer terror. This cutting edge horror anthology from France will curl your toes and rattle your soul.

programme.title: Angel Maker: Serial Killer Queen
programme.desc: In the 19th century, England controlled the biggest Empire the world had ever seen. Scientific breakthroughs, huge scale engineering, and great leaps in medicine led Britain's reign of global power. And yet, behind the facade there was a darkness. An unimaginable world of evil - theft, rape, murder and more. This was the real world of Jack the Ripper and Sherlock Holmes. But there was a lesser known killer on the loose who was far worse than any of the others, a woman who would succeed in becoming one of the world's most prolific serial killers. Her name was Amelia Dyer and she killed over 400 innocent babies. A seemingly gentle old lady, Amelia would take in children under the guise of nurturing and caring for them when in reality she starved and strangled them to death. Explore inconceivable recesses of humanity in this shockingly true story of human darkness and depravity at the turn of the century.

programme.title: Travel with Didiayer S03 E03 - Great Ocean Road NB

programme.title: Cities Reinvented E00 - New York - Tokyo - Singapur
programme.desc: Before long, most of the world’s population will be living in cities. If megacities are to be in a position to tackle the challenges represented by overcrowding, overburdened infrastructure, energy provision and climate change, appropriate structures need to be established. The title shines a light on innovative architectural and urban-planning projects in New York, Tokyo and Singapore that can be considered exemplary responses to some of those challenges.

programme.title: Magic of Zion
programme.desc: Experience the magnificent Zion National Park in its autumn splendor! Brilliant autumn colors combine with the warm red tones of Zions dramatic cliffs to create a visual feast like no other in" Magic of Zion". Also included is rare footage of the endangered American Condor, the largest flying land bird in North America. Watch as a wild parent Condor feeds and nurtures its fledgling on the cliffs of Zion, an awe inspiring sight since there used to be only 50 condors in existence. Available now to subscribers of NatureStream.tv. Runtime 82 minutes.

programme.title: Preview of The High Sierra
programme.desc: This is a preview of "The High Sierra", available to stream at www.NatureStream.tv. Journey into the highest reaches of the Sierra Nevada Mountains in this stunning video presentation featuring the fine art landscape photography of Elizabeth & Olof Carmel. Amazing scenes from "The Range of Light" are paired with beautiful instrumentals to create a relaxing and inspiring experience. Witness the drama of the seasons from summers magnificent wildflower meadows to the deep snows of winter.

programme.title: Coastal Odyssey - Flying Over the Northern California Coast
programme.desc: Soar over the Northern California Coast and experience dramatic sea cliffs, sea arches, waterfalls and crashing waves in "Coastal Odyssey". This 1hour film also features an uplifting musical soundtrack to accompany the inspiring scenes. This film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Journey Through the English Countryside
programme.desc: Glide over the lush green landscapes, white sea cliffs, and castle ruins on this remarkable journey through Englands beautiful countryside, villages and castles. Spectacular cinematography and photography are accompanied by a relaxing soundtrack. Run Time 86 minutes. This full length film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Pro Boxing Archive Series

programme.title: The Rise of Rocky NoHands
programme.desc: S1:E4 How would you feel if you lost in Fortnite to one of the worlds best players, and found out he was using his mouth as a controller? RockyNoHands is a professional eSports Fortnite player, making a career of playing a video game he loves and being among the best in the world at it. After the darkest moment of Rocky’s life left him paralyzed and motionless in a hospital bed, doctors told him he may never walk again. It wasn’t until a source of pure motivation forced him to dig deep to find his unbreakable drive, that he was able to take on his biggest and most rewarding challenge yet.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Jonny Kim
programme.desc: S1:E3 From the outside, Jonny Kim looks like one of the most ambitious people you’ll ever hear about. A person who can become a Navy SEAL, a doctor and an astronaut all before the age of 40 must be a confident, talented person. However, Jonny didn’t grow up aspiring to be a highly trained soldier-doctor capable of going to outer space. It was only until he experienced one of the darkest, most traumatic things a child could go through, that he discovered a calling way bigger than himself.

programme.title: Kim Kardashian & Pete Davidson Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E14 The whole world witnessed Kim and Kanyes marriage fall apart. At first it seemed like they were supporting each other through their divorce, but suddenly Kanye started to publicly attack Kim, accusing her of exploiting and kidnapping their children. What happened? Our team did some digging and traced it all back to Kims performance on SNL. Everyone assumes Kanye’s attacks are because of Pete Davidson, but we uncovered the real reason Kanye turned against Kim Kardashian.

programme.title: Rihanna vs. Chris Brown
programme.desc: S1:E1 Rihanna found herself the victim of assault, from her best friend and then-boyfriend, Chris Brown. Not only was she humiliated in front of the world, but she also faced further attacks from the media, some going as far as claiming the violence was her fault. We uncovered the real story of Rihanna’s experience during and after the incident, not the one portrayed by the media, where she shows us why she is the strong, compassionate, graceful woman the world fell in love within the first place.

programme.title: Katy Perry vs. Russell Brand
programme.desc: S1:E7 Katy Perry is no stranger to toxic relationships. She finally thought she landed the perfect one with bad boy comedian Russell Brand, only for him to divorce her through text message right in the middle of her world tour 2 years later. Our team uncovered the full story of the turbulent aftermath and the journey she went on to become a strong, authentic person who was finally able to fully embrace a healthy relationship.

programme.title: Gwen Stefani vs. Gavin Rossdale
programme.desc: S1:E3 When Gwen Stefani’s happy 20-year relationship with Gavin Rossdale came crashing down, and she started dating Blake Shelton right after the divorce, the media went crazy. Discover the real story of the months of media torture Gwen had to go through, and where she is now in her new relationship with her new man.

programme.title: Jennifer Aniston vs. Brangelina
programme.desc: S1:E12 For almost 20 years, the media portrayed Jennifer Aniston as a heartbroken woman who would never be happy until she had kids. That couldn’t be further from the truth. Our team uncovered details that will prove Brad and Jennifer were the perfect Hollywood couple everybody adored, until Brad suddenly left Jen for Angelina Jolie. This story is so much bigger than Brangelina.

programme.title: Linda Cliatt-Wayman: A Teacher Like No Other
programme.desc: Linda Cliatt-Wayman volunteered to be Principal of one of the most dangerous schools in America. On her first day, she quickly realized that the job was much more complex and frightening than she thought. But, she was determined to give her students hope, even when they were threatening her life.

programme.title: Chadwick Boseman: Live Your Purpose
programme.desc: Chadwick Boseman lived a life of humility and service on and off screen. He didnt let his diagnosis stop him from showing up for those around him and using his platform to elevate black voices. A true hero, he made every day count.

programme.title: Chanel Miller: Write Your Own Story
programme.desc: As the press called her Emily Doe & his legal team tried to frame her assailant Brock Turner as the "star athletes with everything to lose," Chanel Miller remained anonymous. What pushed her to break her silence during the final days of Turners trial? And how did her powerful statement about her sexual assault give a voice to survivors around the world?

programme.title: Elizabeth Smart : Trapped and Lost
programme.desc: Elizabeth Smart was carried off at 14 years old and was missing for 9 grueling months. Those were the worst months of her life, the details of which were so terrible, she refused to share her story for ten years… until something changed. This is her story of survival and strength.

programme.title: Dave Chappelle Tells All
programme.desc: You may love or hate Dave Chappelle, but he did the right thing here. One minute he was the hottest comedian in the country and completely vanished the next. Discover how racism pushed him out of show business and why it’s fuelling his return.

programme.title: Michaela DePrince: From Devil's Child to Ballerina
programme.desc: Most people told Michaela DePrince that life as a ballerina would bring a lot of heartbreak and rejection. But what Michaela faced in the ballet world was nothing compared to her shocking orphanage childhood.

programme.title: David Goggins: The Toughest Man On Earth
programme.desc: Athlete, speaker and soldier David Goggins is known as the toughest man on the planet. Everybody thinks he’s Superman but his internal battle was tearing him apart. In this video, he opens up about a secret he hid from the world and why he feels the need to speak his truth. We hope you enjoy this inspirational short documentary.

programme.title: Ultimate Freedom March: Remembering John Lewis
programme.desc: This short documentary is a tribute to the memory of civil rights leader John Lewis, his relationship with Martin Luther King Jr. and the courage he showed in fighting for an ideal, for freedom, democracy and justice. There is a moment in everyones life when our hearts are pounding and we are inspired and motivated to be the hero of our story. Step forward and go for what you believe in.

programme.title: Zion Clark: No Excuses
programme.desc: Born with no legs, moving from foster home to foster home - where he was often abused - Zion’s life changed when he was adopted by Kimberli. From that point on, he was able to focus on his wrestling career and become a true champion, overcoming his physical differences.

programme.title: Simone Biles: Surviving To Soar
programme.desc: Ultimate gymnastics champion Simone Biles was at the top of her sport and defying gravity at the Tokyo 2021 Olympics. Everyone expected her to win, but every athlete has a breaking point… The Team USA superstar finally opens up about her mental health, the strict pressures of the sports industry and the DISTURBING secret involving Dr. Larry Nassar that she hid for years. Find out what REALLY happened to Simone Biles.

programme.title: Win Against all Odds
programme.desc: Homesick, bankrupt, and father-less, young Dan Lok was devastated when he arrived home one day to find his mom in tears. His riveting coming-of-age story will inspire you to put your best foot forward every single day.

programme.title: "Car Depreciation, which cars hold their value"
programme.desc: "Lets break down what you need to know about depreciation, which cars are winners and losers, and how you can make smarter decisions with your money."

programme.title: Trade Wars & Luxury Cars: Who Pays the Price?
The Hidden Danger of Relying on Traditional Retirement Planning
programme.desc: Have you ever felt fully prepared for something, only to realize that you approached it the wrong way? Its a feeling no one ever wants to experience, especially when it comes to retirement planning. In this video, well explore a real client example, where a couple named Tim and Jennifer were initially on track for traditional retirement planning. However, they came to realize that theres more to retirement than just maximizing your portfolios value. Lets dive into this eye-opening client case and discover what we should do differently.

programme.title: 4 Simple Ways to Increase Your Social Security Benefit in 2024
programme.desc: Having a comfortable retirement is undoubtedly a shared goal, and understanding the intricacies of Social Security can significantly contribute to achieving that dream. In this video, I dive into four simple yet powerful strategies to help you maximize your Social Security benefits.

programme.title: 7 Traps You Must AVOID During The 2024 Annual Enrollment Period
programme.desc: Open Enrollment Period for Medicare is from October 15th through December 7th and in this video from Marvin Marvin from Medicare School, he goes into detail the 7 traps that sales agents use to get YOU to switch your insurance plans! Its important to understand your own plan benefits so that you can avoid tactics from dishonest agents! Whether youre considering switching plans or sticking with your current one, he helps you see beyond the hype and focus on what truly matters for your health coverage! Dont let this Annual Enrollment Period overwhelm you with its flashy offers and high-pressure sales tactics. Marvin will make sure you have the knowledge to spot the traps and secure the coverage you deserve!

programme.title: Social Security Changes That Could Hurt Your Finances in 2024
programme.desc: Stay ahead in 2024 with the latest Social Security updates, brought to you by Marvin Musick from Medicare School. Marvin discusses the key changes in Social Security for the year, including the new Cost of Living Adjustment (COLA) of 3.2. Wondering how this compares to last years 8.7? Marvins got you covered! This is for anyone who is looking to understand how these changes impact their financial planning. Next, Marvin shows you the critical adjustments to the earnings test limits for 2024. If youre considering taking your Social Security benefits early, youll want to pay close attention to this. Learn about the new earnings caps - $2,320 and $59,500 - and how they might affect your benefits if youre still working. Plus, Marvin discusses the increase in taxable income limits for Social Security taxes.

The host presents various culture-related topics in a fun way while also doing some in-depth analysis to give viewers a fuller picture as to what is happening, and why it matters.

programme.title: Global Business
programme.desc: Global Business is the flagship business show of CGTN English Channel, bringing you the latest economic data, business trends and policies.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: DOCUMENTAL
programme.desc: Presentapersonajes y acontecimientos típicos, avances y descubrimientos tecnológicos y científicos, y la civilización social de China.

programme.title: ASÍ ES CHINA
programme.desc: Descubre para el televidente el gran legado cultural e histórico de las distintas regiones y etnias de China. También le acerca a la vida y las costumbres de la gente común y le muestra la evolución del país en aspectos como educación, sociedad y protección del medio ambiente y del patrimonio histórico y natural.

programme.title: CGTN NOTICIAS
programme.desc: Es el informativo estelar del canal, con las últimas noticias del acontecer político, social, deportivo y cultural de China y el resto del mundo. Los hechos que constituyen titulares están aquí, en CGTN Noticias.

programme.title: DOCUMENTAL
programme.desc: Presentapersonajes y acontecimientos típicos, avances y descubrimientos tecnológicos y científicos, y la civilización social de China.

programme.title: RONDA ARTÍSTICA
